intro: Riedlea tenella, commonly known as the slender riedlea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Riedlea tenella is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
